title: SQL Basics
description: SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to interact with relational databases. It lets you create tables, insert data, update records, and retrieve information using clear, structured commands. These basics form the foundation of almost every SQL workflow.

content.text: SELECT retrieves data from a table. It's the most commonly used SQL command.
SELECT * FROM users;
You can select specific columns:
SELECT name, email FROM users;
WHERE filters results based on a condition.

SELECT * FROM users
WHERE age > 18;
INSERT adds a new row to a table.

INSERT INTO users (name, email)
VALUES ('Alice', 'alice@example.com');
UPDATE modifies existing data in a table.
DELETE removes rows from a table.

DELETE FROM users
WHERE id = 1;
Always use WHERE with DELETE â€” without it, you'll remove every row in the table.
ORDER BY sorts results by a specific column.

SELECT * FROM users
ORDER BY created_at DESC;
LIMIT restricts how many rows are returned.

SELECT * FROM users
LIMIT 10;
Joins combine data from multiple tables using shared values. They're essential for working with relational data.
